p: Candida albicans is the species responsible for over 90% of VVC cases, followed by C. tropicalis, C. glabrata, C. krusei, C. parapsilosis, and C. lusitaniae. 1 VVC is common in women following antibiotic treatment, in pregnant women, and in women undergoing hormone replacement. 2 The symptoms of VVC include pain, vulvar erythema, abrasions, pruritus, and a “curd-like” or watery vaginal discharge. 4
